ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, I don t know what compiler you use but I ve learned C and C++ using DJGPP and have actually done a bit of graphic stuff.  I found it wasn t that difficult
ygData.rawEmail:

From:	=?iso-8859-1?Q?Bj=F8rn_Hansen?= <bhansen@...
Subject: Re: Glad

Hey,
    I don't know what compiler you use but I've learned C and C++ using
DJGPP and have actually done a bit of graphic stuff.  I found it wasn't that
difficult to find stuff on it for that compiler(which has a lot in common
with Borland except it's a protected mode thing, anyway. . )  After messing
around with setting the mode myself and drawing colors to the screen and
stuff I discovered it is way more convenient to use a game library for your
graphics routines rather than write then yourself.  It's fun to learn how to
do it though so I would still encourage it.  Let me see if I can dig up some
bookmarks for some good pages. . . .Ok found em.  First of all the DJGPP
site at http://www.delorie.com/djgpp/  has some links, or used to anyway, to
a couple of basic tutorials on VGA programming.  There are also some good
sites strictly for game programming. www.jado.org has lots of links to
sites.  The game programming vault is also a good place to go
http://members.tripod.co.uk/lpfglc/.  The other one I have bookmarked is
http://www.perplexed.com/GPMega/.  I may have more but that's the only ones
I could find easily in my bookmarks.  If you need anything else I'd be happy
to help if I can.  Sorry to everyone else that this isn't really about
gladiator,  though I am also curious what it was programmed in. I hope there
are some other people on this list which the bulk of this message interests.
Also I was kinda disappointed about the Alladvantage thing cause I'm sure
most people have heard about it already, it's kinda hard to miss but enough
of that anyway, I shouldn't have mentioned it.

Since FSgames is temporarily(we hope) on hold with all the projects I can't
help but wonder if there is anything we(the gladiator fans) can do to help,
aside from large monetary donations since I'm sure I'm not the only broke
college student out there.  : )  Ok I've said enough,  happy gaming or
coding or whatever

Bj�rn
